remarks: Simplified version of ~ ellspd when the spanning set is finite: all linear combinations are then acceptable.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 7-Feb-2015.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 21-Jul-2019.)
statement:
ellspd.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` M ) $.
ellspd.v $e |- B = ( Base ` M ) $.
ellspd.k $e |- K = ( Base ` S ) $.
ellspd.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` M ) $.
ellspd.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` S ) $.
ellspd.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` M ) $.
elfilspd.f $e |- ( ph -> F : I --> B ) $.
elfilspd.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. LMod ) $.
elfilspd.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. Fin ) $.
elfilspd $p |- ( ph -> ( X e. ( N ` ( F " I ) ) <-> E. f e. ( K ^m I ) X = ( M gsum ( f oF .x. F ) ) ) ) $.
$d .0. f $.
$d .x. f $.
$d B f $.
$d F f $.
$d I f $.
$d K f $.
$d M f $.
$d N f $.
$d S f $.
$d X f $.
$d f ph $.
